question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
\emph{Multiple choice question: Select ONE correct answer. You will not
be graded for any work.}

Which of these integrals does the sum

\begin{align*}\sum_{k=1}^N \left(\frac3{N}\right) \left[\left(-2+\frac{3k}{N}\right)^3-1\right]\end{align*}

approximate as $N \rightarrow \infty$?

(a) $\int_0^3 x^3\,dx$

(b) $\int_{-2}^1 (x^3-1)\,dx$

(c) $\int_0^3 (x^3-2)\,dx$

(d) $\int_{-2}^1 x^3\,dx$

(e) $\int_0^1 (x-2)^3\,dx$
hints:
The formula for the limit of the Rieman sum is

\begin{align*}\lim_{N\rightarrow \infty}\sum_{k=1}^N\left(\frac{b-a}{N}\right)\cdot f\left(a+\frac{k(b-a)}{N}\right) = \int_a^bf(x)dx.\end{align*}
